channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How social media upended the 75-year-old playbook of big CPG
item.description: Consumers no longer look to television and mass-market media for guidance on what to buy at the supermarket.

item.title: Making Friends at Work Is Harder Than It Used to Be. Here Are 7 Habits to Help
item.description: The relationships you build at work still matter.

item.title: ‘I meant what I said in Davos’: Carney says he really is planning a Canada split with the U.S. along with 12 new trade deals
item.description: He also visibly rolled his eyes at Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s contention that he had walked back his comments at the World Economic Forum.

item.title: This Startup Is Putting an Accent Coach in Your Pocket
item.description: Y Combinator startup BoldVoice is helping non-native english speakers communicate more effectively.

item.title: How 21 Leaders Let Employees Use AI in the Workplace
item.description: Rules vary, and of course not all AI use is sanctioned.

item.title: Target’s New CEO Calls Minnesota Violence ‘Incredibly Painful.’ What He Didn’t Say Is Just as Important
item.description: Michael Fiddelke addresses the retail chain’s more than 400,000 employees after the deaths of Alex Pretti and Renee Good.

item.title: 50-year tradition of Southwest Airlines letting you choose your own seat comes to an end
item.description: An eight‑group boarding structure is replacing the find-your-own-seat scrum.

item.title: Gen Z Wants Big Weddings. That’s Great News for Small Businesses
item.description: A conversation with The Knot Worldwide CEO Raina Moskowitz reveals what young couples want out of their special day.
